data.title: Martin William `Bill' McCann
data.meta_description: Martin William `Bill' McCann, age 76, formerly of Hampstead, died Friday, June 4, 2004 in Washington, DC. He was born in Troy, NY on March 28, 1928 the son of the late Martin J. McCann and Mary Flynnâ€¦
data.text:
He was born in Troy, NY on March 28, 1928 the son of the late Martin J. McCann and Mary Flynn McCann. His wife Claire Heintz McCann preceded him in death.

Mr. McCann was a veteran of the U.S. Army having served during WW II. He was a graduate of Siena College in Loudonville, NY, and spent his professional career with IBM, holding various positions at Poughkeepsie and East Fishkill, NY, and as the General Manager of IBM's Endicott, NY plant.

Mr. McCann moved to the Wilmington area in 1982. He was a former member of the Surf Club and the City Club and a member of the Quest Club. He also served on the board of the North Carolina Symphony and served as the President of Schweitzer Prizes Foundation.

He was a board member of the Wilmington Cardiac Rehab Foundation. Under his guidance and leadership the programs of the Cardiac Rehab Foundation were merged into the New Hanover Regional Medical Center and today is known as the Coastal Heart Center Cardiac Rehab

Surviving are his children, Martin W. McCann, Jr. of Hopewell Junction, NY; Maureen O'Bryan of Bethesda, MD; Mary Christine Webb of Bald Head Island, NC; Michael McCann of Upton, MA; eleven grandchildren and one sister, Mary Theresa Sullivan of Dresher, PA.

Mass of Christian Burial will be held at 10 a.m. Friday, June 11, 2004 at St. Mark Catholic Church. Interment will follow in Oleander Memorial Gardens.

In lieu of flowers the family will greatly appreciate memorials made to: Lower Cape Fear Hospice, 1406 Physicians Dr., Wilmington, NC 28401 or to: Coastal Heart Center Cardiac Rehab - New Hanover Regional Medical Center Foundation, 2259 S. 17th Street, Wilmington, NC 28401.

Andrews Mortuary Market Street Chapel.
